description.narrative: The programme works for the improvement of rural communities? socio-economical situation and quality of life, as well for the strengthening of community capacities in Rajnandgaon, Chattisgarh State, Central India. The programme area suffers regularly from drought and is inhabited mainly by poor landless labor. Malnutrition among children was prevalent and the quality of school education low when the programme implementation started. During the programme implementation, agriculture ? particularly organic far ming ? is developed. This improves food security in the area. The health status of children under 5 and their mothers is improved and the quality of school education strengthened. The programme benefits 64.000 people in 50 villages. The main partner is Wo rld Vision India, which is responsible for the programme implementation and for the utilization of the programme resources.
